title: Sri Lanka President declines the resignation of media minister Godahewa
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s newly appointed minister for media Nalaka Godahewa said he has tendered his resignation to the President two days ago but he has not accepted it.

“I offered to resign two days ago because I wanted the cabinet to be more inclusive and in line with what most people want. He didn’t accept the resignation. I trust more changes will happen in due course,” Godahewa told Economy Next today.
The 56-year old Godahewa was one of the 17 new cabinet ministers who were appointed on April 18 in an attempt to bring in young ministers.
The appointments were made after a growing anti-governmental protest demanding the resignation of the government and its ministers for their incompetencies.
One of the demands of the protestors is to bring in young leaders to the parliament. (Colombo/April22/2022)
